title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 10.8 - Sportfishing regulations for certain privately managed fishing waters
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 10.8 - Sportfishing regulations for certain privately managed fishing waters

State Regulations
(a) On Chatiemac

Lake in Warren County, no person shall take trout except from April 1st through

November 30th. (b) On Balsam Lake
and Winnisook Lake in Ulster County, trout may be taken in any number, any
size, and at any time, including tip-ups. Any trout leaving the premises of the

Balsam Lake or Winnisook Lake clubs must be properly identified as to its
origin. (c) On First Bisby Lake and

Little Moose Lake, Green Lake and Panther Lake in Herkimer County, the
following regulations shall apply: Species

Open season

Minimum length

Daily limit

Method

Trout

All year
9"
10

Ice fishing

Lake trout

All year
15"
3
permitted

Smallmouth bass

All year

Any size
10

Rainbow trout

April 1- November 30

Any size
10
except: (1)

On

Little Moose Lake in Herkimer County, bass may be taken in any number, any size
and at any time. (2)

On Green Lake
and Panther Lake in Herkimer County, trout may be taken from April 1st through

November 30th. Statewide size and bag limits apply. (d) In Goodnow Flow in Essex County, black
bass may be taken in any size and number from the third Saturday in April
through October 15th; angling only permitted. (e) On Blue Lake in Orange County, ice
fishing is permitted. Statewide regulations apply to season, size and bag
limits for all species. (f) On

Frank Masterson Park Pond in the City of Newburgh, Orange County, trout may be
taken all year. Statewide size and bag limits apply to all species; ice fishing
is not permitted. (g) On lower

Ausable Lake and the East Branch of the Ausable River from Russell Falls in

Keene Valley upstream to lower Ausable Lake in Essex County, the following
regulations shall apply: Species

Open season

Minimum length

Daily limit

Trout

All year

Any size
10

following regulations shall apply: Species

Open season

Any size
10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
